title: Ballpark Profile Tab Navigation
custom_preconds:
[Gherkins](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1tSEibxLqKu2nxvNoiRIT9E1JMXwQNiP_MiIeBPzdjRk/edit )

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
custom_steps: WHEN the user is on the Ballpark Home Tab
custom_expected:
THEN the bottom navigation bar is visible
AND the bottom navigation bar contains the "Profile" tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is on the Ballpark Home Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Home Tab is highlighted
AND the "Profile" icon in the bottom navigation bar is in an inactive state
AND the "Profile" icon is not highlighted

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is on the Ballpark Tickets Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Tickets Tab is highlighted
AND the "Profile" icon in the bottom navigation bar is in an inactive state
AND the "Profile" icon is not highlighted

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is on the Ballpark Team Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Team Tab is highlighted
AND the "Profile" icon in the bottom navigation bar is in an inactive state
AND the "Profile" icon is not highlighted

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is on the Ballpark Profile Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the "Profile" icon in the bottom navigation bar is in an active state
AND the "Profile" icon is highlighted to indicate it is the current page

title: Back Navigation within  Profile tab
custom_preconds:

AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
custom_steps:
WHEN the user is on the Ballpark Profile Tab
AND user taps on each feature
AND user taps on back arrow

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown Profile page with Profile icon(navbar) highlighted

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on Edit link at top right
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown the Edit Profile page with a back navigation arrow in upper left corner

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on back arrow
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown Profile page with Profile icon(navbar) highlighted

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user accesses 'My History' via tapping anywhere within "My History" summary section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is shown History page with a back navigation arrow to the left of 'History' header

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on back arrow
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown Profile page with Profile icon(navbar) highlighted

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on 'Favorite Teams'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on 'App Notifications'

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown Profile page with Profile icon(navbar) highlighted

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on 'Ticket Accounts'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on back arrow
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown Profile page with Profile icon(navbar) highlighted

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on 'About Ballpark'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown the About Ballpark page with a back navigation to the left of 'About Ballpark' header

WHEN user taps on back arrow

title: Profile Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user navigates to My Profile page (via Profile Navbar)
custom_steps: WHEN Accessing Profile page via Profile tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on the Profile icon from Navbar
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a generic profile avatar 
AND user is shown their full name displayed 
AND user is shown their favorite team logo (if acct has a fave team prev saved)
AND user is shown their email address 
AND an "Edit" option is displayed in the top right corner
AND "My History" section with relevant data and an actionable icon is shown

THEN the user is shown 'My History' card layered atop the profile card with the User's (check ins) from their My History data:
* Total Check-Ins - dash('-') shown if no prev check-ins exist
* Total Teams Seen - dash('-') shown if no prev check-ins exist 
* Total Ballparks Visited - dash('-') shown if no prev check-ins exist 
* 'View Details' blue text link navigating user to My History 

NOTE: If history data is unavailable display dashes for history counts. User is still able to navigate to My History

THEN the user is shown links to settings items with icons displayed next to each row
* Favorite Teams
* App Notifications
* MLB Go-Ahead ID(Only shown when user enrolled for GAE) 
* MLB Account Emails
* Ticket Accounts
* About Ballpark
* Close MLB Account
* Customer Support
* Do Not Share or Sell My Data (Does not override Apple's Do Not Track Settings)


IF User enrolled to GAE then MLB Go-Ahead ID also display
THEN the user is shown 'Log Out' button below list items

title: My History Summary Card on Profile Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user navigates to My Profile page (via Profile Navbar)
custom_steps: WHEN accessing My History via Profile tab
custom_expected:
THEN My History page's display 
AND the user is able to see their top level ballpark visits on My Profile screen
AND the below validation is expected for the different user states

custom_steps_separated.content:
When user is on 'Profile' page
AND user has prev check-ins associated with their MLB Account
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is shown 'My History' card layered atop the profile card with the User's (check-ins) from their My History data:
* Teams Seen
* Parks Visited
* Check-Ins
* '>' CTA navigating user to My History

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps anywhere within "My History" summary section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown the My History page with expected checked-in event information
AND the summary values shown on My History page match what is shown on My Profile page
* Check-Ins
* Teams
* Ballparks

![](index.php?/attachments/get/8372327)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When user is on 'Profile' page
AND user has NO prev check-ins associated with their MLB Account

* onboard a new acct guarantees no prev checkins
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is shown 'My History' card layered atop the profile card with the User's (check-ins) from their My History data:
* Check-Ins shown as dash('--') since no prev check-ins exist
* Teams Seen shown as dash('--') since no prev check-ins exist
* Ballparks Visited shown as dash('--') since no prev check-ins exist
* '>' CTA navigating user to My History

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps anywhere within "My History" summary section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown the My History page with 'No Games Added' view

![](index.php?/attachments/get/8372325)

title: Log Out
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user navigates to My Profile page (via Profile Navbar)
custom_steps:
WHEN Accessing Profile page via Profile tab
AND user taps log out
custom_expected: THEN the user is logged out

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on the Profile icon from Profile Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a generic profile avatar
AND user is shown their full name displayed
AND user is shown their favorite team logo (if acct has a fave team prev saved)
AND user is shown their email address
AND an "Edit" option is displayed in the top right corner
AND "My History" section with relevant data and an actionable icon is shown
AND a button on the bottom screen labeled "Log Out" is shown  (after all menu options)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on the "Log Out" button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be successfully logged out, and the Log In screen will appear

title: Profile - Display (Name / Email / Edit Profile button / Favorite Team logo)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user in on Profile page

Relevant links:
* [BP-9750](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9750) / [BP-9823](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9823) / [BP-9890](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9890)
* Mocks - [Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/M3vqmrFe2eJlofe392hAqY/Specs?node-id=1284%3A14013)
custom_steps: WHEN user is on the Profile page
custom_expected: THEN Profile page is shown with Avatar, Name, Email, Edit button as top section

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is on the Profile page with an account having a name AND a favorite team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is shown a personalized profile card with the following:
*Avatar - a placeholder avatar for users 
*Fan's name - Show users first and last name, wrap to additional lines if name doesn’t fit
*Fan's email address
*Fan's favorite team logo shown on bottom right of avatar 
*Edit button on top right

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is on the Profile page with an account having a name BUT without a favorite team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is shown a personalized profile card with the following:
*Avatar - a placeholder avatar for users
*Fan's name - Show users first and last name, wrap to additional lines if name doesn’t fit
*Fan's email address
*NO team logo is shown on bottom right of avatar (since no fave team is stored for acct)
*Edit button on top right

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user is on the Profile page with an account NOT having a name AND a favorite team

Acct with No Name (created acct from MLB.com) - maybe best to create a new acct with a fave team set from MLB.com onboarding
* steve.ortiz.mlb+noname@gmail.com / MLBmlb123 / Staging
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is shown a personalized profile card with the following:
*Avatar - a placeholder avatar for users
*Fan's name - Since name fields are null/empty then name not shown
*Fan's email address
*Fan's favorite team logo shown on bottom right of avatar 
*Edit button on top right

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user is on the Profile page with an account NOT having a name NOR without a favorite team

Acct with No Name (created acct from MLB.com) - maybe best to create a new acct without a fave team set from MLB.com onboarding
* steve.ortiz.mlb+noname@gmail.com / MLBmlb123 / Staging
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is shown a personalized profile card with the following:
*Avatar - a placeholder avatar for users
*Fan's name - Since name fields are null/empty then name not shown
*Fan's email address
*NO team logo is shown on bottom right of avatar (since no fave team is stored for acct)
*Edit button on top right

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user is newly onboarded via Sign Up flow 
AND user navigates to My Profile
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is shown a personalized profile card with the following:
*Avatar - a placeholder avatar for users 
*Fan's name - Show users first and last name, wrap to additional lines if name doesn’t fit
*Fan's email address
*NO team logo is shown on bottom right of avatar (since no fave team is stored for acct)
*Edit button on top right

title: Profile - Display (First/Last/Multiple/No Name)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user in on Profile page

Relevant links:
* [BP-9750](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9750)
* Mocks - [Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/M3vqmrFe2eJlofe392hAqY/Specs?node-id=1284%3A14013)
custom_steps: WHEN accessing Profile via Profile tab in different User states
custom_expected:
THEN Profile page's display
AND the below validation is expected for the different user states

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has a name associated within MLB Account
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the name(first and last) is shown

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user has a long first name associated within MLB Account

Acct with Long First Name - Wolfeschlegelsteinhausenbergerdorff TestLast
* steve.ortiz.mlb+longfirst@gmail.com / MLBmlb123 / Staging
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the first name and last name are shown, on additional lines if needed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user has a long last name associated within MLB Account

Acct with Long Last Name - Wolfeschlegelsteinhausenbergerdorff TestLast
* steve.ortiz.mlb+longlast@gmail.com / MLBmlb123 / Staging
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the first name and last name are shown, on additional lines if needed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user has a long first name associated within MLB Account
AND user has a long last name associated within MLB Account

Acct with Long First and Long Last Name - FWolfeschlegelsteinhausenbergerdorff LWolfeschlegelsteinhausenbergerdorff
* steve.ortiz.mlb+longnames@gmail.com / MLBmlb123 / Staging
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the first name and last name are shown, on additional lines if needed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user has a name associated within MLB Account having multiple names and/or hyphenate, such as:
*Vlad Guerrero Jr.
*Michael Harris II
*Byung-Hyun Kim
*Isiah Kiner-Falefa

[ONBOARD A NEW ACCT OR CHANGE THE NAME FOR A TEST ACCT THAT DOESNT REQUIRE TO BE LEFT IN THE DESIRED STATE - i.e noname,longnames,longlast,longfirst]
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the first name and last name are shown, on additional lines if needed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user does NOT have a name associated within MLB Account

Acct with No Name (created acct from MLB.com)
* steve.ortiz.mlb+noname@gmail.com / MLBmlb123 / Staging
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN just the email address is shown (without name)

title: Profile - Edit Mode
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user in on Profile page

Relevant links:
*Mocks:[Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/M3vqmrFe2eJlofe392hAqY/Specs?node-id=1284%3A14013)
EDIT MODE:
*iOS:[BP-9188](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9188)
custom_steps:
WHEN user is on Profile view 
AND User tap on Edit button
custom_expected:
THEN user will be taken to the First/ Last name edit form 

Design: 
Title: Edit Profile 
First Name field 
Last Name field 
Save Changes CTA (filled with black color and White text color)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User is on edit form 
AND user removes all the characters the First name field
AND user navigates to the Last name field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the error text "First Name is required"

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User is on edit form 
AND user removes all the characters the Last name field
AND user navigates to the First name field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the error text "Last Name is required"

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User is on edit form 
AND user types more than 40 characters in the First name field
AND user navigates to the Last name field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the error text "Invalid First Name entered"

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User is on edit form 
AND user types more than 40 characters in the Last name field
AND user navigates to the First name field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the error text "Invalid Last Name entered"

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enter valid First name and Last name 
AND user taps on Save Changes
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user will see the saving animation
AND user will be taken back to Profile view
AND user will be able to see my recently modified name updated

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enter valid First name and Last name with multiple names (i.e Vlad Guerrero Jr., Michael Harris II, Isiah Kiner-Falefa)
AND user taps on Save Changes
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user will see the saving animation
AND user will be taken back to Profile view
AND user will be able to see my recently modified name updated

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User is on edit form AND makes changes to the name fields 
BUT user taps on '<' without saving changes
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user will be taken back to Profile view
AND User will be able to see the names NOT updated

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters valid and different First name and/or Last name 
AND user taps on Save Changes
AND user quit the app, and restarts the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user updated data for profile name should be maintained

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters valid and different First name and/or Last name 
AND user taps on Save Changes
AND user log out of the app and log back in
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user updated data for profile name should be maintained

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user have no network connection*
AND user enters valid and different First name and/or Last name 
AND user taps on Save Changes


*device set to airplane mode can be done to simulate
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown the error text "Profile update failed. Try again later."


Android: 
Unable to Save 
Sorry, check your network and try again.
Dismiss Retry CTA
![](index.php?/attachments/get/14838834)

title: Profile - Edit Mode [External-Proxy]*
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user in on Profile page

Relevant links:
*Mocks:[Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/M3vqmrFe2eJlofe392hAqY/Specs?node-id=1284%3A14013)
EDIT MODE:
*iOS:[BP-9188](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9188)
custom_steps:
WHEN user is on Profile view 
AND User tap on Edit button

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN profile service unavailable* 
AND user Taps on Save (Submit as it shows in design) 

*this can be simulated with proxy tool by adding a breakpoint to https://profile.mlb.com response
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user will see the saving animation
BUT then user is eventually shown(after timeout) the error text 'Profile update failed. Try again later.'
AND the user changes have NOT been updated (can be verified by returning to My Profile)

ANDROID: Network Error message

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user successfully changes to the First Name and Last Name within BP Profile > Edit
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be able to verify the changes by Logging into MLB.com* or through proxy**

*https://www.mlb.com/account/general can be used to verify the acct name change occurs (FOR QA: https://qa-gcp.mlb.com/account/general )
**proxy call would be https://profile.mlb.com/api/v1/profile

custom_steps_separated.content:
(reversely)
WHEN user makes a name change externally (i.e MLB.com) or through mocked proxy**
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be able to see updated profile name on BP app

NOTE: The update will be reflected in BP, only after the Identity Token has been refreshed. W/ ProfileTab, the view may update to see the name change instantly (after navigating away and back to Profile) -- formerly, it can take up to 24hrs to occur organically, but can also be forced via logout/login.

title: Profile - Edit Analytics [Proxy]*
custom_preconds:
iOS: [BP-9213](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9213)

(requires access to a proxy tool to verify the tracking)

*this can be captured with proxy tool by viewing https://mlb.sc.omtrdc.net/b/ss/ request
custom_steps:
WHEN App is started and 
User is on Profile view
custom_expected: THEN tracking is monitored in Adobe

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN Name click - tapping on top profile card selection to edit
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN User should see Analytics call in Proxy as 

trackAction:@"MLB Ballpark : Profile : Edit Click"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user Edit Profile page view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN User should see Analytics call in Proxy as 

trackState:@"MLB Ballpark : Profile : Edit Profile"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is on Edit profile  AND first name click - tap into first name text field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN User should see Analytics call in Proxy a

trackAction:@"MLB Ballpark : Profile : Edit Profile : First Name Click"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is on Edit profile  AND last name click - tap into first name text field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN User should see Analytics call in Proxy a

trackAction:@"MLB Ballpark : Profile : Edit Profile : Last Name Click"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user tap on Save to commit changes
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN User should see Analytics call in Proxy a

trackAction:@"MLB Ballpark : Profile : Edit Profile : Save Click"

title: Favorite Teams
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user navigates to ProfileTab > Favorite Teams

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user selects a favorite team (and saves selection)

Note: Iterate over the 30 teams to verify the team logo is shown correctly for each team.
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the selected team should be reflected with the team's logo shown on bottom right corner of Avatar on Profile page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects multiple favorite teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the tile should increment (1.2.3.4) as more teams are added
AND the 1st team should be reflected on Profile page with the team's logo shown on bottom right corner of Avatar

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects and deselects favorite teams on Favorite Teams view
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the counter should decrement and the previous order should be retained

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user returns to the Home Page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
AND the Home Tab should show your #1 favorite team should be highlighted in the TeamSchedule context card
AND the Home Tab should no longer show the FaveTeam context card (with selection prev made)

[CONTEXT CARDS ARE REGULATED BY CARD CREATOR - Team Schedule & Fave Team context cards may not be shown, if not configured]

title: Favorite Teams - Profile Service *[External-Proxy]
custom_preconds:
[BP-9781](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9781)
[BP-9782](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9782)

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
WHEN user navigates to ProfileTab > Favorite Teams
AND user successfully makes change to the primary favorite team
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the selected team should be reflected with the team's logo shown on bottom right corner of Avatar on Profile page

AND user should be able to verify the favorite team changes by Logging into MLB.com* or through proxy**

*https://www.mlb.com/account/teams-players can be used to verify the favorite team name change occurs (for QA - https://qa-gcp.mlb.com/account/teams-players )
**proxy call would be https://profile.mlb.com/api/v1/profile

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
WHEN user navigates to ProfileTab > Favorite Teams
AND the user selects multiple favorite teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the tile should increment (1.2.3.4) as more teams are added

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects multiple favorite teams (and saves selection)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be able to verify the favorite team changes by Logging into MLB.com* or through proxy**

*https://www.mlb.com/account/teams-players can be used to verify the favorite team name change occurs
**proxy call would be https://profile.mlb.com/api/v1/profile

[ONLY PRIMARY TEAM IS SAVED WITHIN MLB.COM]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects and deselects favorite teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the counter should decrement and the previous order should be retained

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user returns to the Home Page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
AND the Home Tab should show your #1 favorite team should be highlighted in the TeamSchedule context card
AND the Home Tab should no longer show the FaveTeam context card (with selection prev made)

[CONTEXT CARDS ARE REGULATED BY CARD CREATOR - Team Schedule & Fave Team context cards may not be shown, if not configured]

custom_steps_separated.content:
(reversely)
GIVEN user makes a fave team change externally (i.e MLB.com) or through mocked proxy**
WHEN user logs in with MLB account in Ballpark app


[BP-11016](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11016 ) Confirm logout/login is required for external change to be maintained within BPapp
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the MLB account favorite team is automatically applied as user's first favorite team 


[Testing notes, verifiable by confirming:
*Team logo layered on the avatar on Profile page
*Profile > Favorite Teams
*Home tab api call request body via proxy (visually this can be validated with the “Take me out to the ballgame!” context card)
*Team tab icon
*Buy Tickets and Team tab default selected club]

[BP-11222](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11222 ) could be cause if not seeing Profile update

custom_steps_separated.content:
(reversely)
GIVEN user does not have a fave team set on MLB Account (i.e MLB.com)
WHEN user logs in with MLB account in Ballpark app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the MLB account favorite team is defaulted without a favorite team 


[Testing notes, verifiable by confirming:
*NO Team logo layered on the avatar on Profile page
*Profile > Favorite Teams (no teams set)
*Home tab api call request body via proxy (visually this can be validated with the “Take me out to the ballgame!” context card)
*Team tab icon (MLB logo)
*Buy Tickets and Team tab (unselected)]

title: App Notifications  - Display
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user in on Profile page

title: About Ballpark
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user navigates to My Profile page (via Profile Navbar)
custom_steps: WHEN user taps on Profile bottom nav bar tab
custom_expected: THEN 'About Ballpark' is shown with an icon as a menu option

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on 'About Ballpark'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN app displays a new page with 'About Ballpark' as title
AND user is shown read-only device/acct information:
*Application Version
*Build Number
*Operating System
*Device ID
*MLB Account


AND user is shown additional drawer options (Terms of Use, Privacy Policy)
AND user is shown 'Developer Tools' on Debug builds (non-Release Candidates)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Terms of Use' within About Ballpark page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN webview of Terms of Use is shown with back nav ('<')and refresh icon

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on refresh icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Terms of Use page remains open and page is refreshed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps back navigation
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to About Ballpark page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Privacy Policy' within About Ballpark page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN webview of Privacy Policy is shown with back nav ('<')and refresh icon

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on refresh icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Privacy Policy page remains open and page is refreshed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps back navigation
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to About Ballpark page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user back navigates from 'About Ballpark' page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is taken back to 'Profile' page

title: MLB Go-Ahead ID
custom_preconds:
iOS: [BP-10587](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10587)

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user has already completed the successful enrollment in Go-Ahead Entry program (required for drawer option to be shown --  ballpark://go-ahead can be used to register to GAE)
AND user navigates to My Profile page (via Profile Navbar)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User is on Profile page
AND user has already completed the successful enrollment in Go-Ahead Entry program
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be display with drawer option "MLB Go-Ahead ID" on Profile page

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User is on Profile page
AND user hasn't completed the successful enrollment in Go-Ahead Entry program
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should not display with drawer option "MLB Go-Ahead ID" on Profile page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User taps on the "MLB Go-Ahead ID"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN selection of "MLB Go-Ahead ID" leads user to new view

AND New view should displays user enrollment status [Enrolled (in blue background w/ white text) 

MLB Go-Ahead ID - Header/Title

'<' on top left corner in same line as MLB Go-Ahead ID

Text Display: 
The Go-Ahead Entry experience allows you to enter the stadium hands-free and is available at select ballparks. 
Tap here for more information and a list of participating ballparks.


'Delete MLB Go-Ahead ID' display in white within black pills button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Tap here' within the MLB Go-Ahead ID profile page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to an external browser opened to an appropriate page* with more information on Go Ahead Entry

*the webpage is configured as 'go_ahead_mlb_ballparks_url' in remote config

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user navigates back to BP app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN MLB Go-Ahead ID page is shown

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User taps on the "MLB Go-Ahead ID"
AND user taps on "Delete MLB Go-Ahead ID"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should display a Deletion prompt modal 

Body/Text: 

Delete MLB GO-Ahead ID 
Deleting your MLB Go-Ahead ID will remove your ID and require re-enrollment in the program. 

Delete Go-ahead ID - CTA
Cancel - CTA

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user select "Delete Go-Ahead ID" on the Deletion prompt modal
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is removed from Go-Ahead entry program
AND the user is returned to Profile page 
AND the Profile page no longer shows MLB Go-Ahead ID entry

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user successfully Unenrolled from MLB Go-Ahead ID
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should not display with MLB Go-Ahead Entry/ID drawer option on Profile page

title: MLB Account Emails - Email Verification Status
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app  (14.0 or greater)
AND user in on Profile page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on the MLB Account Emails option
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN a service call is made to retrieve list of emails and verification status associated with logged in user

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user taps on the MLB Account Emails option
AND primary email status is successfully retrieved
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Primary email address associated with logged in user is displayed and verification status that was retrieved is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user taps on the MLB Account Emails option
AND primary status is not successfully retrieved & has never been successfully retrieved
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Primary email address associated with logged in user is displayed but the verification status is blank

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user taps on the MLB Account Emails option
AND the service call to get the list of emails and verification status associated with logged in user and the service call fails
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN an error message is displayed to the user

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User’s primary email is not yet verified
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Resend' button is displayed
AND message is displayed in red text 'This email is not verified for ticket access'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN: User’s primary email is verified
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN: The email is listed under "You're logged in with the following email"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN: User has no verified secondary emails
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN: The verified section will not be displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN: User has no pending secondary emails
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN: The pending section will not be displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN: User has verified secondary emails
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN: The list of verified secondary emails are displayed along with a checkmark
AND: Text "Your MLB account can access tickets purchased using these emails" is displayed below verified emails

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN: User has pending secondary emails
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN: The list of pending secondary emails are displayed along with a resend button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN: Email address is too long to fit in primary status area or in the verified & pending list items
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN: The size of the font is reduced and ellipses added to prevent overlap with checkmark or resend button

title: MLB Account Emails - Ticket Access Information Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user in on Profile page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on MLB Account Emails option
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN MLB Account Emails page is shown with a section labeled "Having trouble finding your tickets?"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN: The user selects the "i" on the "Having trouble finding your tickets?"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN: The user is shown a screen describing email verification.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN: Informational screen with text is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then: A screen with title "Ticket Access" is displayed with information for the users.

Android: A screen with title "My MLB Account Emails" is displayed with information for the users.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN: User presses back button in top tool bar
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN: User is returned back to My MLB Account Emails

title: MLB Account Emails - Email Resend - Successful
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user has an account that has not accepted the email to verify an account.
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user in on MLB Account Emails page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN: The user selected the "RESEND" button on the cell associated with their email address.
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN: A service call is made to get the verification status of the displayed email

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN: The service call is successful
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN: An alert is presented to the user

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN: The service call is successful
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN: The “Resend” text is changed to “Sent” and the button is disabled. Button remains disabled until the user navigates away from My Account page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN: The service call is successful
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN: Screen is scrolled as necessary so that resent item is visible on screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN: The service call indicates that the user has already verified
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN: The verified emails list is refreshed based on results of service call and the email status is updated to reflect that the primary email is now verified

title: MLB Account Emails - Email Resend - Failure
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user in on MLB Account Emails page
custom_steps: WHEN: The user selected the "RESEND" button on the cell associated with their email address.
custom_expected: THEN: When the call fails they will get an alert

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps the Resend button
AND the service calls fails

(this can be achieved by removing network connection)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the account didn't accepted the email to verify the same account 
AND an error prompt with "Verification Email Not Sent" as title is presnted

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN: User acknowledges displayed alert
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN: Page is refreshed and newly added email address is now in pending list

title: MLB Account Emails - Add Secondary Email - Invalid Email

AND user in on Profile page
AND user in on MLB Account Emails page
AND user taps the Add Another Email 


WIKI: [Add Secondary Email](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/mobile/pages/19727697/Verify+Email#Add-Secondary-Email)
custom_steps: WHEN: The user presses send with an invalid email address

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN The user presses send with an invalid email address
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Add secondary email gives error message "This must be a valid email Address."

title: MLB Account Emails - Add Secondary Email - Dismiss keyboard button
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user in on Profile page
AND user in on MLB Account Emails page
AND user taps the Add Another Email

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN selecting "Add Another Email"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the cursor will start at the beginning of the line and "Add Another Email" text will still be displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user starts typing in an email address
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the "Add Another Email" text will disappear

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects send after adding in the email
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the dialog is displayed & once its dismissed, the keyboard will be hidden

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects "Cancel" on the keyboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Keyboard will be dismissed and the line will show the partially entered email address or "Add Another Email"

title: MLB Account Emails - Add Secondary Email - Already Verified
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user in on Profile page
AND user in on MLB Account Emails page
AND user taps the Add Another Email

custom_steps_separated.content: The user submits a valid email address that has ALREADY been added
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 
[iOS]
Title: Verification Email Not Sent
A verification email could not be sent to [email]
![](index.php?/attachments/get/14593408)

[Android]
Title: Verification Email Not Sent
The user is presented with an alert that says “Email address [email] is already verified with this account”

OK 
![](index.php?/attachments/get/14593407)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN: User acknowledges the alert
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN: A service call is made to refresh the email verification list

title: MLB Account Emails - Remove Email
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user in on Profile page
AND user in on MLB Account Emails page
AND user taps the "Remove" option on "Your Other Verified Accounts"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User presses on "Remove" option
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN List of verified and pending emails items are updated with an option to click to signify "remove" this email from the list
THEN "Remove" option is changed to "Done"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User presses on remove icon for a list item in the verified email list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a confirmation dialog is displayed to the user with option to cancel or remove

Exact Text: Message is displayed "By removing, you will no longer be able to see tickets purchased using [SECONDARY EMAIL JUST SELECTED FOR REMOVAL] while logged into [PRIMARY CURRENTLY LOGGED IN MLB ACCOUNT EMAIL]"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User presses on remove icon for a list item in the pending email list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Header: Remove Email?

Body: By removing, you will no longer be able to see ticket purchased using [CURRENTLY SELECTED FOR REMOVAL EMAIL ADDRESS] while logged into [Primary email]
Options: Cancel / Remove

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User confirms to remove the verified item
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN service call is made to unverify the email address associated with the selected item.
THEN dialog is dismissed
THEN the list is updated and selected item is removed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User selects cancel in dialog to remove the verified or pending item
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN no service call is made and the item remains in the list

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User selects "Done" option
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN list items are displayed in manner prior to remove mode = returns to resend, sent, or check mark

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User confirms to remove the verified or pending item and service call fails
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN dialog with error message is displayed with OK option to dismiss

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User adds another email
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN pending verification list is updated with new email

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User selects "remove"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN newly added email address show remove icon
THEN newly added email address can be removed
